info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 3:58AM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...In Colorado, Kit Carson and Cheyenne Counties. In Nebraska, Hitchcock and Red Willow Counties. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Locations southeast of a line from McCook, Nebraska to Cheyenne Wells, Colorado will see the most amount of snow. Exact placement of the highest snow amounts is still in question. Locations west of a line from Goodland, Kansas to Leoti, Kansas will see the highest winds and have potential to experience blizzard conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
